comment.shortText: [`Cryptographic hash function`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Cryptographic_hash_function)
`128` bits.
`128` bits.
`128` bits.
`160` bits.
`256` bits. Collision Resistant.
`384` bits. Collision Resistant.
`512` bits. Collision Resistant.
Has trailing padding. Does not wrap lines. Does not have a trailing newline.
Format the digest is returned in.

The `digestStringAsync()` method of `Crypto` generates a digest of the supplied `data` string with the provided digest `algorithm`.
A digest is a short fixed-length value derived from some variable-length input. **Cryptographic digests** should exhibit _collision-resistance_,
meaning that it's very difficult to generate multiple inputs that have equal digest values.
You can specify the returned string format as one of `CryptoEncoding`. By default, the resolved value will be formatted as a `HEX` string.
On web, this method can only be called from a secure origin (https) otherwise an error will be thrown.
comment.returns: Return a Promise which fulfills with a value representing the hashed input.

comment.shortText: The cryptographic hash function to use to transform a block of data into a fixed-size output.
The value that will be used to generate a digest.
Format of the digest string. Defaults to: `CryptoDigestOptions.HEX`.

Generates completely random bytes using native implementations. The `byteCount` property
is a `number` indicating the number of bytes to generate in the form of a `Uint8Array`.
Falls back to `Math.random` during development to prevent issues with React Native Debugger.
comment.returns: An array of random bytes with the same length as the `byteCount`.

comment.shortText: A number within the range from `0` to `1024`. Anything else will throw a `TypeError`.

Generates completely random bytes using native implementations. The `byteCount` property
is a `number` indicating the number of bytes to generate in the form of a `Uint8Array`.
comment.returns: A promise that fulfills with an array of random bytes with the same length as the `byteCount`.

comment.shortText: A number within the range from `0` to `1024`. Anything else will throw a `TypeError`.
The `getRandomValues()` method of `Crypto` fills a provided `TypedArray` with cryptographically secure random values.
comment.returns: The input array filled with cryptographically secure random values.

comment.shortText: An integer based [`TypedArray`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray) to fill with cryptographically secure random values. It modifies the input array in place.
